result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rico Antonio Viera

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rico Antonio Viera not in court.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court for Rico Antonio Viera.  Attorney Dennis Patrick Murphy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a calendar call. Defense advised the court that defendant appeared during the AM session. Court vacates the imposed and stayed bench warrant. Defense requested a status conference. Court adjourns matter for a status conference. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court.  Defendant not present, not in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Defense requested calendar call date.  Calendar call scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Rico Antonio Viera in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland, appear by video.  Defendant Rico Antonio Viera in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 25, Judge Rothstein. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rico Antonio Viera not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be set for status; denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Rico Antonio Viera in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Rico Antonio Viera in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge Franke, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
